clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Benefits of Ultrasound in Improving the Diagnosis and Management of Injuries the Child's Ankle
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Benefits of Ultrasound in Improving the Diagnosis and Management of the Child's Traumatic Ankle Injuries

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate ankle's ultrasound contribution in the accuracy of ankle's diagnosis of traumatic injuries (objectivated by reference's examination : ankle's MRI)

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic performance rate of anatomical lesions of the ankle of ultrasound
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of ankle ultrasound compared to MRI, considered as a gold standard, in the diagnosis of traumatic ankle injuries

secondary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic performance rate of anatomical lesions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (inclusion) and at visit 2 (within 7 days after the baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Specificity, predictive values (positive and negative) and likelihood ratios (positive and negative) of ultrasound versus MRI

secondary_outcome.measure: The use of Ottawa decision rule
secondary_outcome.description: the place of Ottawa criteria and ultrasound in the decision algorithm to limit standard radiographs (and thus irradiation). The Ottawa Ankle Rule was derived to aid in the efficient use of radiography in acute ankle and midfoot injuries.

secondary_outcome.measure: orthopedic rehabilitation quality at 3 weeks according to the Oxford score.
secondary_outcome.description: The Oxford Ankle Foot Questionnaire for Children (OxAFQ-C) is used to measure subjective well-being for child patients (aged 5-16) affected by foot and ankle conditions using issues that are considered important to children. The OxAFQ-C has 15 items, 14 of which are used to calculate domain scores: Physical (6 items); School and Play (4 items) Emotional (4 items)

arm_group.description: Ankle ultrasound performed on the day of emergency consultation member MRI (without injection of contrast products) performed within 7 days following the trauma

intervention.description: Ankle ultrasound performed during emergencies visit.
Member MRI (without injection of contrast product) performed within 7 days following the trauma

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 5 years and < 18 years
- Isolated's trauma from one or both ankles
- First-line consultation for pediatrics emergencies at the University Hospital of Lille
- Informed and written consent of the holders of parental authority
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 5 years and ≥ 18 years
- History of trauma of the same ankle dating from less than 3 month
- History of surgery of this same ankle
- Constitutional or acquired bone disease
- Associated trauma affecting another anatomical region than the ankle or midfoot
- Polytrauma (presence of several traumas including at least one endangers vital functions)
- Associated wound requiring surgical exploration
- initial management of this trauma in another center
- Non affiliation to a social security scheme
